msContents.summary: Letter from Gemellus to Epagathus with certain instructions.

msItemStruct.note: Text is on one side only, 12-14 lines written with the fibers. Top and left margins clearly visible. Text mentions locations of Aphroditopolis and Apias.
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology collection

supportDesc.support: 9.5 x 10.8cm. Badly damaged margins on all sides with many holes of varying sizes throughout, though primarily on the right side. The top right corner is especially damaged.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1898-9) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1901, Dr. Parrish Collection).

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: Lucius Bellenus Gemellus to his own Epagathus, greeting. Please send me two forks and two shovels and a winnowing-fan, as I am feeling the want of them at Aphroditopolis. Reap the field at Apias and let the sheaves go off immediately to A..., and dig the olive-yards at Apias ... (Grenfell, Hunt & Hogarth)

listBibl.bibl: P. Fay. 120 John R. Abercrombie, "The University Museum's Collection of Papyri and Related Materials," Expedition 20.2 (Winter 1978): 32-37. Nicolas Hohlwein, "Le veteran Lucius Bellienus Gemellus: Gentleman-farmer au Fayoum," Etudes de Papyrologie vol. 8 (1957): 69-91.
